articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Cote d'Ivoire President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Cote d'Ivoire President
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Laurent Gbagbo, President of Cote d'Ivoire, on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of its independence.
					Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation existing between the two countries would grow stronger in line with the interests of the two peoples, Kim in the message heartily wished the President and the people of Cote d'Ivoire greater success in their efforts fo durable peace and development of the country.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Jamaican PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Jamaican PM 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim Friday sent a message of greetings to Bruce Golding, Prime Minister of Jamaica, on the 48th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished him and the Jamaican people successes in their work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun on Attainment of MDGs
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun on Attainment of MDGs
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Special Ministerial Meeting for Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) Review in Asia and the Pacific was held in Indonesia on 3 and 4.
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, head of the DPRK delegation, said in his speech that the on-going wars and military conflicts in different parts of the world, the daily expanding military blocs and  the escalating new arms race among big powers, the global environment being rapidly degraded due to pollution and depletion and the financial and economic crisis sweeping the world are the main factors of threatening the peace and security of the world and throwing hurdles in the way of attaining the MDGs.
					
					 Underscoring the need for the meeting to pay serious attention to these matters, he expressed the following views of his delegation on the implementation of the MDGs:
					
					 What is important is to create a peaceful environment, set right the present international economic structure on the principle of impartiality and increase the role of the UN, he said, adding that all the UN organizations should give priority to boosting the support to developing countries in development and pay special attention to helping them secure stable and long-term financial resources as required by these countries.
					
					  He stressed, in particular, the need not to allow any attempt to use the aid of the UN organizations including the United Nations Development Programme as a lever for pursuing a political purpose.
					
					 He noted that the DPRK proposal for concluding a peace treaty was aimed at removing the root cause of posing a constant threat to the peace and security in the region, establishing a lasting peace-keeping regime on the Korean Peninsula and providing a peaceful environment for the nation's economic construction and the improvement of the standard of people's living.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever boost the cooperation with all countries in the world in their efforts to build a new peaceful and prosperous world, guided by the idea of its foreign policy-- independence, peace and friendship-- and make a positive contribution to the efforts of the international community to attain the MDGs, he concluded.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Indonesian Vice-President
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Indonesian Vice-President
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Indonesian Vice-President Boediono met and had a talk with the visiting DPRK delegation led by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun in Jakarta on Wednesday.
					 The vice-president said that the friendly relations between the two countries have a long history.
					
					 He referred to the fact that President Kim Il Sung visited Indonesia and met with President Sukarno in April 1965.
					
					 Indonesia will continue to favorably develop the relations with the DPRK, he stressed.

articles.title: Flowers from Britain Party and Chinese Company
articles.content:
Flowers from Britain Party and Chinese Company
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) and the Emperor Group of Hong Kong, China, sent floral baskets to the DPRK missions in those countries on July 27 and 31 on the occasions of the 50th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership and the 57th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of CPV
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Cemetery of Fallen Fighters of CPV
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A wreath was laid before the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province, on Friday by the Sino-DPRK friendly visiting group led by Xin Qi, vice-president of the China Association for International Friendly Contact, staying in the DPRK to mark the 60th anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers into the Korean front.
					 The participants placed bouquets before the grave of Mao Anying.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the CPV who heroically fought on the Korean front.
					
					 The visiting group visited the Songhung Revolutionary Site on the day.
					
					 The head of the delegation made an entry into the visitor's book at the end of the visit.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Sino-DPRK friendly visiting group led by Xin Qi, vice-president of the China Association for International Friendly Contact, staying in the DPRK to mark the 60th anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers into the Korean front.
					 The gift was handed over to an official concerned by Xin Qi on Thursday.

articles.title: Rev. Han Sang Ryol Visits Wonsan
articles.content:
Rev. Han Sang Ryol Visits Wonsan
  Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Rev. Han Sang Ryol, pro-reunification champion of south Korea, visited various parts of Wonsan City of Kangwon Province between August 2 and 5.
					 After being briefed on the Wonsan Youth Power Station which sprang up as a modern monumental structure in the era of Songun before a big map showing its panoramic view, he went round iron pipes stretching down along mountain cliffs and Power Station No. 1.
					
					 He also visited Wonsan University of Agriculture and the Songdowon International Children's Camp. 
					
					 He met workers of Kosong County of Kangwon Province after touring Kuryong Falls of Mt. Kumgang, a famous mountain of Korea, Lagoon Samil and the area of Sea Kumgang.

articles.title: Remains of More Martyrs Buried in Cemetery
articles.content:
Remains of More Martyrs Buried in Cemetery
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Remains of more martyrs were buried in the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery. 
					 They included former General Officer Kim Chi Dok who, holding a responsible post of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces for nearly five decades, devoted himself to the construction of important objects, thus contributing to the development of the nation's economy and improvement of the standard of people's living, and Han Kwi Nam who contributed to the strengthening and development of the Party as a railway worker-turned vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Also among them were Ri Tong Chun, a writer of the Room for Creation of the former Ministry of Public Security who created over 100 literary works including light comedy "Echo of Mountain" and Hwang Pyong Chol, former vice-president of the Phibada Opera Troupe who made a contribution to the development of Juche-oriented arts.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il made sure that the soldiers who glorified their lives on the road of struggle for the country's prosperity, remaining intensely loyal to President Kim Il Sung and the Party were buried in the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery and sent them wreaths in his name.

articles.title: Int'l Table Tennis Tournament Prepared
articles.content:
Int'l Table Tennis Tournament Prepared
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The 24th Pyongyang International Invitation Table Tennis Tournament will be held in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea from August 9 to 13.
					 The tournament, involving men's and women's team events, singles and doubles, will be participated in by some 50 paddlers from Korea (a and b teams), China, Russia, Mongolia and Nigeria.
					
					 Ju Jong Chol, secretary general of the Table Tennis Association of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, told KCNA that preparations for the tournament had already been finished. 
					
					 He also said that Table Tennis Gymnasium in Chongchun Street, the venue of the tournament, had undergone facelifting and that training, lodging and boarding facilities were waiting for the participants. 
					
					 A poster introducing the tournament had also been brought out, he added.
					
					 The Pyongyang International Invitation Table Tennis Tournament, which started in Juche 70 (1981), has served as a good occasion in strengthening sports exchange and cooperation among nations and propelling the development of table tennis technique.

articles.title: New Species of Vegetables Cultivated
articles.content:
New Species of Vegetables Cultivated
						
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- New species of vegetables bred by the Central Vegetable Research Institute of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have been cultivated in some co-op farms in the country.
					 The institute has introduced high-yielding spring and summer cabbages suitable to the climatic and soil conditions of the country, and some species of greenhouse hot pepper in vegetable farms. 
					
					 It has also disseminated the methods and technique of their cultivation to farms, paying deep concern to planting summer cabbage seeds as second crop, cultivating cabbage seedlings and preventing damage from harmful insects.
					
					 Summer cabbage, resistant to hot and humid weather and change of climate, yields a rich harvest with a small quantity of fertilizers.
					
					 Yellow hot pepper, considered higher than other species in nutritive value, has enjoyed popularity among experts and producers.

articles.title: Efficacious Veterinary Medicines Developed
articles.content:
Efficacious Veterinary Medicines Developed
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Newly developed veterinary medicines have widely been used in stockbreeding and poultry farms in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					Among them are ionized CMF (Ca, Mg, Fe) and spirulina injection.
					
					The ionized CMF, a substitute for vitamin D3 and calcium phosphate, is popular among breeders and veterinaries as it helps prevent and treat rickets of domestic animals.
					
					It has been applied to more than ten stockbreeding and poultry farms to cure rickety young fowls and animals in a week.
					
					The medicine is low in the production cost but highly efficacious for rickets and osteomalacia.
					
					Spirulina injection is a vaccination which prevents and treats domestic animals' diseases and increases their weight.
					
					The medicines, which are of great significance in livestock breeding of the country, were developed separately by the IT Introduction Department of the State Academy of Sciences and the Agrobiology Research Institute of the Academy of Agricultural Science.

articles.title: Ouster of Traitorous Regime Called for
articles.content:
Ouster of Traitorous Regime Called for
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean conservative group is a wicked group of traitors as they are escalating confrontation between the north and south and the tension on the Korean Peninsula in league with foreign forces and standing in the way of achieving national reunification and ferocious fascist dictatorial forces keen to mercilessly block the independent and democratic advance of the people and bring back the past dictatorial era.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the sinister intention of the Lee Myung Bak group to hurt and stifle the DPRK, backed by the U.S. 
					
					 From the very outset of its office, the conservative group regarded it as its top priority task to "strengthen the alliance" with the U.S. and pursued "a policy towards the north" the keynote of which is to disarm the DPRK and stifle it, systematically straining the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 The fascist maniacs are now suppressing by violence the just activities of the progressive organizations and figures struggling for social progress and the reunification of the country after labeling them "forces subservient to the north" and "enemy-benefiting forces" and the like.
					
					 The group of traitors again picked up the already bankrupt "theory of coloring". 
					
					 Koreans can never successfully pave the way for carving out their independent destiny as long as the group of traitors is allowed to stay in power to escalate the inter-Korean confrontation and bring the danger of a war of aggression against the DPRK in collusion and tie-up with foreign forces and thoroughly fascistize the south Korean society. 
					
					 A failure to eradicate the source of trouble in good time would bring a greater disaster.

articles.title: S. Korea's War Maneuvers for Invading DPRK Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korea's War Maneuvers for Invading DPRK Flayed
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification issued a statement on August 4 in protest against the south Korean puppet bellicose forces' reckless moves for a war.
					The statement recalled that the Command of Forces of the Korean People's Army in the western sector of the front clarified its resolute stand that it would react with strong physical retaliation to the anti-submarine drill to be staged by the group of traitors in the West Sea of Korea from Aug. 5 with huge armed forces of the three services of the puppet army, marine corps and various type of warships and other war hardware involved. 
					
					If the group kicks off the maneuvers for a war of aggression against the north at any cost, it will suffer from the north's counteraction for self-defense, the statement warned, strongly urging the Lee Myung Bak group to stop those war maneuvers unconditionally as they would make the Korean Peninsula drenched with the blood shed by fellow countrymen.
					
					All Koreans will certainly wipe out the U.S. and its warlike lackeys in the spirit of "By our nation itself", the statement concluded.

articles.title: Ceaseless Struggle against Discrimination Policy in Japan
articles.content:
Ceaseless Struggle against Discrimination Policy in Japan
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The struggle against the Japanese authorities' unjust policy of discriminating against Korean schools is going on in Japan.
					 Ri Kwang Sang, chairman of the Nagano Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and Ri Song Gil, principal of Nagano Korean Junior Middle School, together with members of the Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea visited the Social-Democratic Party and the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan on July 27 to demand that the tuition-free program be applied to the Korean schools without discrimination.
					
					 They charged that the exclusion of Korean schools from the tuition-free program for senior high schools is a continuation of the Japanese government's unjust policy of discriminating against the Korean residents in Japan and stamping out their national education.
					
					 Officials of the Hokkaido Headquarters of Chongryon and teachers of Hokkaido Korean Junior and Senior High School, together with members of the Hokkaido Citizens' Council for Japan-Korea Solidarity, handed to the SDP and the Ministry of Education of Japan a written request and a signature paper signed by at least 15,000 people on July 28.
					
					 They stated that the Japanese government should immediately renounce its wrong policy toward the issue of aiding Korean schools and ensure the right of Korean students in Japan to learn their national culture and history.
					
					 Teachers and parents of students of Fukushima Korean Junior Middle School and representatives of the Japanese Society for Supporting Fukushima Korean Junior Middle School, too, called at the Ministry of Education on July 29 to present a signature paper endorsed by over 12,000 people and a written request addressed to the Japanese prime minister.
					
					 Earlier on July 20, the Aichi Branch of the Free Judiciary Group, a Japanese organization of lawyers, released a statement.

articles.title: ILPS Assails Anti-DPRK Moves of US-S. Korea
articles.content:
ILPS Assails Anti-DPRK Moves of US-S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The International League of People's Struggle (ILPS) issued a statement on July 24 condemning the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities for their moves against the DPRK.
					 The statement denounced their provocative moves against the DPRK, which are being intensified as never before, as a violation of the Korean people's sovereignty and a threat to peace in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities orchestrated the case of sunk warship "Cheonan" and are escalating such hostile actions against the DPRK as accusations, military threat and sanctions, it pointed out, stressing that it is quite natural for the DPRK to bolster up its nuclear deterrent so as to cope with the developments.
					
					 The ILPS is opposed to the U.S. imperialists' scheme to provoke a new war against the DPRK, it said, calling upon the world people and member and related organizations of the ILPS to extend support and encouragement to the Korean people's struggle for independence and protest against the U.S. imperialists' moves for aggression on the DPRK and demand the immediate withdrawal of the U.S. forces from south Korea.
					
					 The Ecuadorian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung issued a statement on July 27 in which it denounced the war moves of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities.

articles.title: Anniversary of Start of Songun Leadership Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Start of Songun Leadership Observed 
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Meetings and book exhibitions were held in Italy and Germany and a book and photo exhibition opened in Guinea between July 23 and 26 to celebrate the 50th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 Displayed in their venues were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their Songun revolutionary leadership exploits and books and photos introducing the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving nation and achieve the national reunification.
					
					 Speeches were made at the functions.
					
					 The secretary of the Livorno City Committee of the Communist Reconstruction Party of Italy said that Kim Jong Il developed in depth the Juche idea, the Songun idea, founded by Kim Il Sung, in keeping with the requirement of the era of independence and turned socialist Korea into a powerful country, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence, undeterred by any moves of the imperialists for aggression and war.
					
					 Victory and glory are always in store for the Korean people as they are under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il, he stressed.
					
					 The secretary of the Livorno City Committee of the Communist Party of Italy said that the victory of Korean socialism is reliably guaranteed thanks to the Korean People's Army which has grown to be strong revolutionary armed forces and invincible army under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il although the U.S. is running wild to stifle the DPRK by force.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Jong Il's Songun leadership has made it possible for the Korean people to defend the sovereignty of the country and victoriously advance the cause of socialism despite any trials and hardships.
					
					 The exploits he performed for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence with his Songun politics will remain long, the speaker stressed.

articles.title: RPDC contribuira al alcance de las metas del milenio
articles.content:
RPDC contribuira al alcance de las metas del milenio
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar los dias 3 y 4 en Indonesia la reunion ministerial especial de la region para revisar el cumplimiento de las metas de desarrollo del milenio en Asia y el Pacifico.
					  Al hacer uso de la palabra, el canciller coreano Pak Ui Chun, quien preside la delegacion coreana, insistio en que las guerras y los conflictos militares persistentes en varias regiones del mundo, el bloque militar que se amplia con el paso de los dias, la nueva carrera armamentista que se endurece entre las potencias, el ecosistema en vias de contaminacion y destruccion y la crisis economica financiera que azota el mundo devienen factores principales que amenazan la paz y la seguridad del mundo e impiden el alcance de las metas de desarrollo del milenio.
					
					  La presente reunion debe prestar gran atencion a tal situacion, subrayo y aclaro el criterio de la delegacion coreana relativo al cumplimiento de las metas del milenio.
					
					  Lo importante es procurar el ambiente pacifico, arreglar justamente la actual estructura economica internacional y elevar la papel de la ONU, dijo y agrego que todas las organizaciones de la ONU deben dar prioridad a fortalecer el apoyo al desarrollo de los paises en vias de desarrollo y prestar atencion especial a establecer la fuente financiera estable y duradera que satisfaga la demanda de estos paises.
					
					  En particular, no se debe permitir jamas todos los intentos de usar la cooperacion de desarrollo del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo y otros organismos de la ONU como medio para ciertos fines politicos, apunto.
					
					  La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea propuso la concertacion del convenio de paz con el proposito de eliminar la fuente de la amenaza permanente a la paz y la estabilidad de la region, establecer el sistema duradero de aseguramiento de la paz en la Peninsula Coreana y preparar el ambiente pacifico por la construccion economica del pais y la mejora de la vida popular, enfatizo.
					
					  En el futuro tambien, segun su ideal de la politica exterior fundamentada en la independencia, la paz y la amistad, la RPDC ampliara y desarrollara aun mas la cooperacion con todos los paises del mundo aspirantes a construir un nuevo mundo pacifico y prospero y hara aporte activo a los esfuerzos de la sociedad internacional por alcanzar las metas de desarrollo del milenio, concluyo.

articles.title: Vicepresidente indonesio departe con canciller coreano
articles.content:
Vicepresidente indonesio departe con canciller coreano
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ATCC) -- El vicepresidente de la Republica de Indonesia Boediono se reunio el dia 4 en Jakarta con la delegacion coreana encabezada por el canciller Pak Ui Chun, de visita en su pais.
					En la ocasion el vicepresidente dijo que las relaciones de amistad Indonesia-Corea tienen larga historia.
					
					Recordo el encuentro entre el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Presidente Sukarno durante la visita del primero a Indonesia realizada en abril de 1965.
					
					Indonesia seguira desarrollando positivamente las relaciones con Corea, subrayo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena al "poder" vendepatria de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena al "poder" vendepatria de Lee Myung Bak
						
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ATCC) -- La banda de conservadores surcoreanos es la horda de traidores a la nacion que en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras, agrava la confrontacion fratricida entre ambas partes coreanas y la tension de la Peninsula Coreana e impide la reunificacion de la nacion.
					Ademas, esas connotadas fuerzas fascistas y dictatoriales actuan con desesperacion para reprimir implacablemente la lucha independiente y democratica de los habitantes y recuperar la epoca de dictadura del pasado.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este viernes y continua:
					
					El intento de la banda de Lee Myung Bak radica en calumniar y aplastar a la RPDC bajo el amparo de EE.UU.
					
					Desde el comienzo de su mandato, la banda de conservadores surcoreanos presento el "fortalecimiento de la alianza" con EE.UU. como su prioridad mas grande y vino destruyendo sistematicamente las relaciones con la RPDC esgrimiendo la "politica sobre el Norte" cuyo nucleo es desarmar y aplastar a este.
					
					Hoy dia, volviendo a sacar la ya desgastada "teoria de colores", reprimen fieramente las justas actividades de las entidades y las personalidades, que luchan por el progreso social y la reunificacion del pais, tildandolas de "fuerzas seguidoras al Norte y pro-enemigas".
					
					Si se perdona a la banda de traidores que agrava la confrontacion fratricida en contubernio con las fuerzas extranjeras y convierten a la manera fascista la sociedad surcoreana trayendo el peligro de la guerra contra la RPDC, la nacion coreana no podra forjar con exito su destino de modo independiente.
					
					Por lo tanto, hay que eliminar a tiempo ese rompecabezas antes de que el dolor se haga mas fuerte.

articles.title: Terminados preparativos de torneo internacional de tenis de mesa
articles.content:
Terminados preparativos de torneo internacional de tenis de mesa
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ATCC) -- Tendra lugar durante 5 dias a partir del dia 9 en esta capital el XXIV Torneo Internacional de Tenis de Mesa por Invitacion de Pyongyang.
					  En este evento, que tendra las modalidades colectivas e individuales de ambos sexos y el doble mixto, participaran mas de 50 jugadores de Corea (grupos A y B), China, Rusia, Mongolia y Nigeria.
					
					  En entrevista con la Agencia Telegrafica Central de Corea, el secretario general de la Asociacion de Ping-Pong de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ju Jong Chol (de 47 anos de edad), dijo que ya terminaron los preparativos para celebrar con exito el torneo.
					
					  Subrayo que quedaron acondicionadas perfecta y magnificamente las instalaciones internas y externas del Centro de Tenis de Mesa en el reparto Chongchun, sede del torneo.
					
					  Ademas, se han dado las excelentes condiciones para el entrenamiento y alojamiento de los competidores y se dio a luz hasta el afiche del torneo, agrego.
					
					  Esta cita deportiva, que data del 70 (1981) de la Era Juche, deviene una buena ocasion para fortalecer el intercambio y la cooperacion en la rama deportiva entre los paises y estimular el desarrollo de las tecnicas de esa disciplina.
